Package au.edu.anu.aot.errorMessaging

Interface ErrorMessagable

All Known Implementing Classes:
SpecificationErrorMsg
public interface ErrorMessagable

An interface to manage error messages in a user-friendly way.

Purpose: these messages inform the user as to what steps to take to get a possibly complex specification valid.

  1. for any error there is the error description and action to undertake to fix it, hence two messages;
  2. the error context can be described by increasing the level of message verbosity.
  • The lowest verbosity ('brief') just returns the action message
  • The intermediate verbosity ('detailed') adds to it the error message
  • The highest verbosity ('debug') adds to it context information
Author:
Ian Davies - 30 Nov 2019

  • Method Details

    • actionInfo

      String actionInfo()
      Brief description of the error
      Returns:
      the action message

    • detailsInfo

      String detailsInfo()
      Detailed description of the error
      Returns:
      the action message + error message

    • debugInfo

      String debugInfo()
      Debugging information about the error
      Returns:
      the action message + error message + context information

    • category

      String category()
      Allows some way of organizing messages in some category order. Best used as a prefix to all verbose1/2 strings.
      Returns:
      error message category.

    • errorName

      String errorName()
      Largely for debugging. Some information that indicates exactly the type of message. For example implementations may use enums and so the type could be the enum.name(). Additional prefix to verbose2 strings.
      Returns:
      Error name description.
